intro: Impatiens aliciae var. pandavaramalayensis, commonly known as the Pandavaramalayeni Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and grows as an herbaceous perennial. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture and botanical gardens.
